titleStmt.title: The birth of a day: being a treatise theologicall, morall and historicall, representing (as in a scene) the vicissitudes of all humane things, with their severall causes and sacred uses. Compos'd for the establishing mans soul unchangeable in the faith, amidst the various changes of the world. / By J. Robinson Mr of Arts and preacher of Gods Word.
titleStmt.author: Robinson, John, Preacher at East-Thorpe.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Roger Daniel; and are to be sold by Thomas Johnson, at the sign of the Golden Key in S. Pauls Churchyard,

notesStmt.note: Annotation on Thomason copy: "Nouemb: 17"; the second 5 in the imprint date has been crossed out and replaced with a "4".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.

place.placeName: the sign of the Golden Key in S. Pauls Churchyard
